header_summary:
Calvin Kim, Tadge Dryja, Davidson Souza, and others have proposed three Bitcoin Improvement Proposals (BIPs) focused on Utreexo, aimed at enhancing Bitcoin transactions by enabling verification without storing the full Unspent Transaction Output (UTXO) set. This initiative seeks to streamline blockchain efficiency and scalability, with the proposals available for community feedback on [GitHub](https://github.com/utreexo/biptreexo). Meanwhile, Gloria Zhao announced the release candidate for Bitcoin Core version v29.1rc1, emphasizing the importance of community testing and feedback to ensure the software's reliability and stability, with binaries and source code accessible [here](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-29.1/test.rc1/) and [here](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/tree/v29.1rc1) respectively.

In another development, Tim Ruffing's research highlights the post-quantum security of Bitcoin's Taproot, demonstrating that quantum computing does not currently pose a significant threat to Taproot's security when limited to script-path spending. This research supports the potential for a two-phase softfork upgrade for integrating post-quantum signatures into Bitcoin, available for review at [Cryptology ePrint Archive](https://eprint.iacr.org/2025/1307). Furthermore, discussions by ajtowns and others explore the transition from mining rewards to transaction fees within Bitcoin mining, examining the implications for mining dynamics and blockchain economics, as well as a detailed comparison between the security mechanisms of Coinbase Vault and the proposed BIP 345, considering operational, technical, and economic perspectives. These conversations underscore the evolving landscape of Bitcoin's infrastructure, the collaborative effort toward enhancing security and efficiency, and the critical role of community involvement in the development process.

recent_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] Utreexo Nodes
recent_posts.summary:
- Tadge Dryja, Davidson Souza, and Calvin Kim propose three Bitcoin Improvement Proposals using Utreexo.
- Utreexo aims to verify transactions without the full Unspent Transaction Output set, enhancing blockchain efficiency.
- These proposals are staged for community feedback on GitHub to refine the new verification method.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 29.1 release candidate available
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version v29.1rc1 binaries are now available for download.
- Release candidate allows users to test and provide feedback before the final version.
- Community testing and feedback are essential for software refinement and stability.

recent_posts.title: Taproot is post-quantum secure when restricted to script-path spends
recent_posts.summary:
- A study shows Bitcoin's Taproot safe against quantum attacks using QROM and SHA256.
- Suggests two-phase softfork for Bitcoin, enhancing security against quantum threats.
- Quantum computing not seen as immediate threat to Bitcoin's Taproot security levels.

recent_posts.title: Fingerprinting nodes via addr requests
recent_posts.summary:
- The proposal suggests setting GETADDR timestamps to a fixed, past value.
- A primary concern is creating a synchronized pattern, risking a 'Terrible' label.
- This could threaten network diversity by filtering out batches of addresses simultaneously.

recent_posts.title: Where does the 33.33% threshold for selfish mining come from?
recent_posts.summary:
- Transitioning from rewards to fees in Bitcoin mining alters inflation concerns and dynamics.
- Fee-based mining shifts how block production rates influence Bitcoin's economical landscape.
- This shift necessitates considering transaction space and market reactions for miner revenue.

recent_posts.title: On the possibility of evil covenants and implications for soft fork proposals
recent_posts.summary: - The Coinbase Vault employs a two-phase security, requiring signer approval and providing a cancellation window.  - BIP 345 centers on enabling Bitcoin transaction cancellations through an on-chain visibility feature.  - The discussion explores the feasibility and challenges of integrating SMS validation into blockchain consensus mechanisms.

active_posts.title: Make pathological transactions with more than 2500 legacy signature operations non-standard
active_posts.summary:
- The activation of BIP54 poses risks due to 2500 invalid legacy sigops.
- A proposal suggests delaying BIP54 to avoid DoS attacks by classifying transactions as non-standard.
- Bitcoin Core PR 32521 aims to bolster network security before BIP54's activation in version 30.0.

active_posts.title: Revisiting secp256r1 signatures (i.e. P256, mobile HSM support)
active_posts.summary:
- Significant past discussions on adding P256 to Bitcoin focused on security and adoption barriers.
- Recent technical advancements like Tapscript facilitate P256 integration, potentially enhancing security and user experience.
- Enabling P256 could leverage secure hardware on mobile devices, broadening Bitcoin's accessibility and applicability.

active_posts.title: Proposal: Self-Verifiable Transaction Broadcast Log for Enhanced User Transparency
active_posts.summary:
- Liang proposes a Self-Verifiable Transaction Broadcast Log to enhance Bitcoin's auditability.
- The feature records transactions with timestamps, aiming to address lost transaction issues.
- Liang seeks community feedback on this opt-in feature before formalizing the proposal.

active_posts.title: Changes to BIP-360 - Pay to Quantum Resistant Hash (P2QRH)
active_posts.summary:
- BIP-360 updates enhance Bitcoin's defense against quantum threats by focusing on Taproot integration.
- The approach simplifies protection strategies, avoiding emergency changes upon quantum viability (Q-Day).
- Future plans include a separate BIP for Post-Quantum signatures, ensuring adaptability and ongoing security.

active_posts.title: Exploring Extended Relative Timelocks
active_posts.summary:
- Discussion on extending Bitcoin's timelocks to ~10 years arises from user feedback.
- A proposed method involves using bit 21 in the `nSequence` field for longer timelocks.
- Experimentation and feedback are sought for the suggested adjustments and their broader implications.

active_posts.title: Fee-Based Spam Prevention For Lightning
active_posts.summary:
- Jager and Teinturier suggested protocols for LN fees to cover routing costs, noting potential vulnerabilities.
- Enhancements now secure fees with payment secrets and burn outputs to prevent theft and encourage cooperation.
- The refined protocols introduce Upfront, Hold, and Success Fees to improve LN's efficiency and spam resistance.

today_in_history_posts.title: BIP 118 and SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- ZmnSCPxj discussed a Taproot version of Decker-Russell-Osuntokun (eltoo) on a mailing list.
- He proposed a channel with a single taproot pubkey and specific signing mechanisms.
- Richard Myers sought clarification on several technical aspects of the protocol.

today_in_history_posts.title: Dynamic Commitments: Upgrading Channels Without On-Chain Transactions
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Rusty introduces a `commit_switch` method for safer Lightning Network upgrades.
- He suggests maintaining initiator-only sessions to avoid collision issues.
- Proposes a tiered approach to channel upgrades, emphasizing backward compatibility.

today_in_history_posts.title: Deflationary money is a Good Thing
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Investment strategies include passive holding assets and active direct engagement.
- Passive investing may cause societal issues, such as asset misalignment and underutilization.
- Proposes central banks use inflationary currency backed by deflationary ones to stabilize economies.
